title: Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
legend: The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the Agenda 2030 for Sustainable Development were decided upon by the UN General Assembly in 2015. This sub-category indicates whether SDGs were mentioned in the (I)NDCs and whether mainstreaming of SDG and (I)NDC implementation is planned

legendBuckets.txt: Aim to mainstream INDC contribution and SDG implementation

BOL.txt: Aim to mainstream INDC and SDG implementation

GHA.txt: Aim to mainstream INDC and SDG implementation (INDC's inclusion of both mitigation and adaptation resonates with SDGs)

GTM.txt: Aim to mainstream INDC and SDG implementation (mainstreaming the INDC in the plan on achieving the SDGs (KATUN 2032))

IND.txt: Aim to mainstream INDC and SDG implementation (India’s INDC takes into account the imperatives of meeting the SDGs)

MAR.txt: Aim to mainstream INDC and SDG implementation (Align NDC with goals 1, 6, 7, 8, 9, 11, 12, 13, and 17.)

NPL.txt: Aim to mainstream INDC and SDG implementation (tackle poverty and climate change simultaneously to achieve SDGs)

LKA.txt: Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) mentioned (climate change exacerbates existing challenges to attain the SDGs)

SWZ.txt: Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) mentioned (climate change exacerbates existing challenges to attain the SDGs)

THA.txt: Aim to mainstream INDC and SDG implementation (adaptation in developing countries helps to achieve the SDGs)

UGA.txt: Aim to mainstream INDC and SDG implementation (emission reductions as reflected in goal 13 of the SDGs)

title: Sustainable Development
legend: Sustainable development is socially inclusive and environmentally sustainable economic growth. The concept was a cornerstone of the 1989 Brundtland report as well as three global UN conferences (1992 UNCED; 2002 WSSD; 2012 UNCSD). This category indicates whether (I)NDCs mention sustainable development

IDN.txt: Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) mentioned: ('take into account' SDG on NDC issues like water and energy access, gender equality and food security)

PAK.txt: Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) mentioned: (climate change exacerbates existing challenges to attain the SDGs)

title: Fossil fuel subsidy reform
legend: Indicates countries’ commitment in INDCs to change or phase out state subsidies of fossil fuels.

BFA.txt: Subsidy reform mentioned (to reach INDC goals)

EGY.txt: Subsidy reform mentioned (phase out energy subsidies within 3-5 years)

ETH.txt: Plans for subsidy reform mentioned (remove subsidies to enhance generation and use of clean and renewable energy)

GHA.txt: Subsidy reform mentioned (phase out fossil fuel subsidies)

IND.txt: Subsidy reform mentioned (has cut subsidies and increased taxes on fossil fuels (petrol and diesel))

MAR.txt: Subsidy reform mentioned (i.a. reduction of public subsidies for different petroleum products)

NGA.txt: Plans for subsidy reform mentioned (travel costs should better reflect true cost, e.g. through road pricing, subsidy reform)

SAU.txt: Plans for subsidy reform mentioned (decrease market distortion (fuel taxes); subsidies for complementary energy sources)

VNM.txt: Plans for subsidy reform mentioned (implement roadmap to phase out fossil fuel subsidies)

title: Green growth/green economy
legend: ‘Green growth’ is a relatively new concept that describes low-emission and resource efficient economic growth. Ultimately, green growth should lead to green economies

legendBuckets.txt: Green growth/economy strategy to be developed

ARM.txt: Green economy mentioned (INDC based on principle of 'Green Economy')

BEN.txt: Green economy mentioned (creation of a ministry for the promotion green economy)

KHM.txt: Green growth/economy strategy exists (Green Growth Policy & Roadmap)

COM.txt: Green growth mentioned (efforts made for green development policy)

COG.txt: Green economy mentioned (aim to implement INDC within green economy)

DMA.txt: Green growth mentioned (receive climate finance to support green growth)

ETH.txt: Green growth/economy strategy exists (Green Economy Vision and Startegy)

FJI.txt: Green growth/economy strategy exists (Green Growth Framework)

GMB.txt: Green economy mentioned (priority financing for public infrastrucutre which is critical for transition green economy)

GUY.txt: Green economy mentioned (overarching INDC goal is to achieve green economy)

JOR.txt: Green growth/economy strategy to be developed (National Green Growth Plan and Implementation Roadmap)

LAO.txt: Green growth mentioned (export of clean energy stimulates green growth in neighbouring countries)

MYS.txt: Green growth/economy strategy exists (pursue green growth goal under the Eleventh Malaysia Plan (2016-2020))

MLI.txt: Green growth/economy strategy to be developed (sustainable funding strategy for climate change and green growth)

MEX.txt: Green growth mentioned (promotion of inclusive green growth as a co-benefit of adaptation and mitigation)

MAR.txt: Green economy mentioned (legal and institutional framework reformed to enable transition to green economy)

NER.txt: Green growth mentioned (green growth objective of INDC)

RWA.txt: Green growth/economy strategy exists (Green Growth and Climate Resilience Strategy)

SLE.txt: Green economy mentioned (INDC contributes to shift to green economy)

SGP.txt: Green growth mentioned (green growth important for mitigation efforts)

ZAF.txt: Green economy mentioned (South Africa Green Climate Fund to catalyse and demonstrate green economy intiatives)

KOR.txt: Green growth/economy strategy exists (Framework Act on Low Carbon, Green Growth)

SWZ.txt: Green economy mentioned (2015 National Climate Change Policy supports development of a green economy)

TJK.txt: Green economy mentioned (international suport critical to realisation of green economy)

TGO.txt: Green economy mentioned (information on transition to green economy to inform implementation of INDC)

UGA.txt: Green growth mentioned (link long-term climate-resilient and low-carbon development to green growth development plan)

ARE.txt: Green growth/economy strategy exists (Green Growth Strategy)

VNM.txt: Green growth/economy strategy exists (National Green Growth Strategy)

title: G20 Legend Title
legend: The G20 (or Group of Twenty) is an international forum for the governments and central bank governors from 20 major economies, founded in 1999

The Least Developed Countries (LDC) is a group of the countries that, according to the United Nations, exhibit the lowest indicators of socioeconomic development in the world. The concept of LDCs originated in the late 1960s
A landlocked country is a sovereign state entirely enclosed by land, or whose only coastlines lie on closed seas.

In spite of their geographical and cultural diversity, SIDS share similar economic and sustainable development challenges such as low availability of resources, susceptibility to natural disasters, and excessive dependence on international trade. SIDS generally lack of economies of scale, and have high transportation and communication costs
The OPEC is a permanent, intergovernmental organisation, created in 1960 to co-ordinate and unify petroleum policies among its Member Countries

legendBuckets.txt: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC)
Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD)
